clauses.text: (5) RMIT is committed to a consistent and coordinated approach to establishing, awarding, managing and reviewing scholarships and prizes.
(6) RMIT supports scholarships and prizes that align with:
RMIT’s strategic mission
Strategy of Knowledge with Action.
(7) RMIT scholarships and prizes:
have clear and specific objectives which are reflected in the proportionate value
are allocated fairly and inclusively against transparent eligibility criteria and selection processes
have practicable terms and conditions, are cost-effective and managed through transparent and coordinated processes.
(8) Grievances and complaints relating to the administration of scholarships and prizes are managed in accordance with the Student and Student-Related Complaints Policy.
(9) Responsibility for approving the establishment, amendment and rescission of a scholarship or prize is determined by the Delegations of Authority Policy according to value and funding source.
(10) The following positions are responsible for the overall management of scholarships and prizes:
Executive Director, Students; coursework Scholarships, scholarships for Global Experiences
Director, Global Student Recruitment; scholarships for commencing international students
Deputy Vice-Chancellor Education; RMIT Vietnam scholarships and prizes, RMIT University prizes
Deputy Vice-Chancellor Research and Innovation; RMIT research prizes
College Deputy Vice-Chancellor; college prizes
Dean/Head of School/Cluster Director; school or industry cluster prizes.
(11) The operational units in colleges and portfolios that manage scholarships and prizes are responsible for:
reviewing new scholarship or prize proposals
making selection decisions against stated criteria
maintaining accurate records of scholarship and prize recipients
monitoring ongoing eligibility by conducting regular checks such as enrolment status and academic progress
canceling recipient’s scholarships as required in accordance with relevant terms and conditions.
(12) Schools, colleges and portfolios that administer scholarships and prizes report annually:
to Academic Board, for scholarships
to the Deputy Vice-Chancellor, Education, for prizes.
(13) This policy will be reviewed at least once every five years in accordance with the Policy Governance Policy.
(14) Refer to the following documents which are established in accordance with this policy:
Scholarships and Prizes Procedure
